title: Famous Grouse
author: Famous Grouse
content: How will the crypto market perform post-market turmoil? Will the bear take control long-term?

comments.author: livingfree
comments.body: Quote from: Famous Grouse on November 15, 2022, 01:45:26 AMHow will the crypto market perform post-market turmoil? Will the bear take control long-term?Typically, bear markets are quite long and it could take up to the next halving. So, don't go easy on it while we've got still time, there's a tendency that the market won't be ending up with this turmoil that we're seeing. The bears are there and you'll have to be patient at most times until we see those signs. Mostly thought that when bitcoin has reached $21k, it's likely the end but no way. It's a cycle and typical cycles of the market takes time and it's going to be a long way ahead.

comments.author: KellyHands
comments.body: The bear market has been up for over a year now and it doesn't seem to be coming to an end anytime soon. Based on precedence, we tend to have a longer period for the bearish trend as compared to the bullish market. It would be awesome to have the bull run commence as the bear market has been up for a while now.

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: Quote from: Famous Grouse on November 15, 2022, 01:45:26 AMHow will the crypto market perform post-market turmoil? Will the bear take control long-term?Nobody takes control long term. Bitcoin & crypto moves in cycles, we currently, since the inception of bitcoin, move in four year cycles which are around the halving. Sentiment can change a lot & very quickly during the four year cycle but overall it swings from bull to bear market & even has a sustained period of sideways action, low volatility. The best way to win in this game is just to buy & hold for many years. Nobody ever loses money this way in bitcoin. It takes a lot of patience & isn’t much fun but dollar cost averaging over years is fool proof. You will make much more profit this way than in any traditional bank savings or investment vehicle.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: First, the market has to find the bottom, after which the market will begin its recovery and subsequent growth. A bearish trend cannot continue indefinitely, just like a bullish trend. At some point the market will turn to growth. When will that happen? In my opinion, when the Fed announces that it will stop rolling back liquidity or something like that. Without monetary initiatives, the market will not be able to recover. In other words, the crypto winter will last exactly as long as the recession will last.

comments.author: ethereumhunter
comments.body: Bear markets can last long, and we've seen that happen in the last few years. Whereas the bull market phase started and it hit a price peak, the prices for all coins started dropping. And that's also made the price of bitcoin decline. We've seen it decline rapidly. But the bear market will not last forever because sooner or later, the bull market will come and replace the bear market. And that can help us to be able to see big profits again from many coins because almost all coins, especially potential coins, will start increasing rapidly. If that happens, we will experience a bull market phase and must be prepared to take advantage of that.
